H0.text: Sunlight is the source of energy for nearly all ecosystems, which explains why photosynthesis is the foundation of most food webs.

H1.text: Most ecosystems are found on land instead of in water.

H2.text: Carbon dioxide is more available than other gases, which explains why photosynthesis is the foundation of most food webs.

H3.text: The producers in all ecosystems are plants, which explains why photosynthesis is the foundation of most food webs.

A4.text: convert light energy — typically from sunlight — into the chemical energy necessary to fuel their metabolism

A5.text: Photosynthesis was discovered in 1779 by Jan Ingenhousz who showed that plants need light, not just soil and water
